job_title: RECORDS SECRETARY in San Antonio, TX
pros:
Great vacation time and sick leave with flexible(ish) scheduling. The staff are GREAT! I LOVED the people I worked with.  All except for one- who has been there for many years and needs to retire. 
I would work here again just for the people and community.
cons: There is a lot of miscommunication or none at all. The main campus does not allow external campuses to manage their own processes and students very well. The systems are very outdated which makes processes slower and confusing for staff and students. Salaries are not adequate for experience and education. There is not a lot of opportunity for growth, unfortunately.

pros: The majority of the people at the external and main campus are nice. The students are great. The work-life balance is great and the job can be very rewarding. Deans at the external level are great and really care about their sites.
cons: The budgets for the external sights are minimal and it is hard to promote and market with minimal money and supplies. There is a huge disconnect between the main campus and the external sites. The main campus does not really understand how each external site functions which makes it getting certain things done harder.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sierra Vista, AZ
pros:
Great team environment. Staff and upper management are friendly and sincerely care about their employees and students and work hard to make sure everyone has the support they need.  The organization works hard to provide affordable ad effective solutions to the students and especially strives to honor their military student's professional experience and how it contributes to their academic success. 
 There was great satisfaction in being able to make a difference.
cons: Budgets were fairly limited which made it difficult to provide better resources and team support as needed.

pros: The staff treats one another as Family. It is very Christ focused and prayer is a common occurrence during the day. All of the faculty works together as a team.
cons: The technology that is utilized is a bit outdated.  There is also a lack of formalized training and there is a great need for consistency within the external and main campuses.
